But why does the upscaled version look DIFFERENT?
I mean, as described, the lines and thinner and such, it seems like a whole different drawing-style all of a sudden.
I don't think it's the meaning of "higher quality", as it changes the artist's work.
I mean, even if it's in SD, it can still be of high quality, being DVD-quality then, which should also represent as it was made, even though not with as much detail.
Imagine it happening with a film, different lines and such... would be weird.

@hosukka:
VLC is a shitty player and no encoder recommends to use it to play the video.

http://mpc-hc.sourceforge.net/

Well, that's weird.
Cause the VLC-one is the only player of many I've tried that plays about anything I throw at it.

Also, I just gave the other one in the link a try.
And the first thing I tried to play it said "Cannot render video." .
How ironic is that. :P

Also, I can actually play the videos in this torrent with VLC Media Player.
No additional codecs used.
So something's up with hosukka's software I guess...

@DamageIncM:

Install the combined community codec pack, found here:
http://www.cccp-project.net/

Then both media player classic and windows media player will be able to play .mkv files. You'll find, though, that media player classic is the best one to use.
There are some tracks missing...

@MadeInGreece: Yeah, the OST is unofficial so there has to have missing tracks. But I think the team responsible for releasing this unofficial OST has updated their work. Try to find their latest one by google.
